intro: Daucus pumilus subsp. microcarpus, commonly known as the dwarf carrot, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its fruit is a small, round, orange-brown achene, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
